Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the upper-body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially pale-red in section, the interior is thickly encrusted with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394427) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394427)
